entry.content:
So, what are you reading?
I'm picking up Levy's *Hackers*, frankly because I was curious about the strangely eastern touches of many cyberpunk styles one sees in film. Per the [Jargon File](http://www.catb.org/~esr/jargon/),
>...many hackers are influenced to varying degrees by Zen Buddhism or (less commonly) Taoism, and blend them easily with their 'native' religions. There is a definite strain of mystical, almost Gnostic sensibility that shows up even among those hackers not actively involved with neo-paganism, Discordianism, or Zen. Hacker folklore that pays homage to 'wizards' and speaks of incantations and demons has too much psychological truthfulness about it to be entirely a joke.
